title: How do I unlock my Pixel 3a for a new SIM card?
content:
I bought my phone directly from Google and set it up with Verizon about a year ago. This month, I tried to switch my phone line to T Mobile, but when I put in T-mobile's SIM card, I get an error message saying my device is locked. 

I called T Mobile, Verizon, and Google. Here is what each said: 

T mobile: When they put out the request for Verizon to transfer my phone line, it should automatically unlock my phone. If it's not working, I should contact Verizon.

Verizon: My phone should not be locked in the first place unless it has been reported missing/stolen or if there's a payment due. I should contact Google since that's where I bought the phone.

Google: Agent tried out a couple different solutions (turn on Developer option, do a factory reset), neither of which worked. He finally told me to contact Verizon because my phone says it is "carrier-locked".

Does anyone know how I can unlock my phone???
